column4: ni answer in the #sane channel - hope i can find some basic halp in this channel. just brought a new scanner (epson 2500) , and I'm trying to figure out how to make it work with ubuntu.
you may need the iscan packages, available online. Why didnt you check compatibility before purchasing
I did. sane mentioned "good" support for this model
cool, lets see what we can find
please dont truncate product names, it makes searches harder and less accurate
http://avasys.jp/eng/linux_driver/test_result.php   use the debs there, may help
tahnk you. will give it a try.
do you know how to access SANE  backend interface?
no idea dude. I've only encountered 1 scanner in my life and the iscan made it work (was also an epson)
did the iscan packages not make it fly?
although I installed virtual box with the supplied Driver and it worked
now i know that the scanner is functioning. yet can't make it work the way I want it.
I tried to install one of them I scanner  *.deb file but i got an "Dependency is not satisfiable: libltdl3 (>= 1.5.2-2)" error
then you will need to find a deb to satisfy that dep
